intro: Trichanthecium caaguazuense, commonly known as the Caaguazú grass, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Paraguay. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem, supporting various insect and bird species.
